page.title: 07CHEESE MAKING AT HUNTBACH'S
page.content: There is a cheese making farm two miles away from Adderley at Heyfields farm,but locally it's called Huntbach's Cheese Making Farm.Andrew and I went to watch them making cheese.There were three people working in the building,a woman and two men.They start in the morning at about five o'clock and finish at twelve o'clock.Huntbach's have been making cheese since 1957.When the Cheshire Cheese is made it goes to Crewe to be sold in the open market.They make 2000 gallons of milk into cheese everyday half of it comes from Northwards Farm.When they have made the cheese they have to put it in metal containers and then press it.After it has been pressed it goes to the store room for up to five days.
